channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Unpacking the $10 billion sale of the LA Lakers
item.description: The Los Angeles Lakers announced that the team will be sold for $10 billion. Author and historian Jeff Pearlman explains what this means for the franchise and the sport of basketball.

item.title: Claims that seed oils are harming Americans' health are causing problems for farmers
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and others have said that seed oils are poisoning Americans. The medical community mostly rejects those claims, but they are causing problems for farmers.

item.title: Shock and terror over the Israel-Iran conflict permeates LA's Persian diaspora
item.description: Members of the large and diverse Iranian American community in Los Angeles express their feelings about Israel's attacks and Iran's response.

item.title: Why it's hard to hire air traffic controllers
item.description: Federal aviation authorities have been trying for years to hire more air traffic controllers, but they've fallen short of their goals. We look at why it's so hard to train enough controllers.

item.title: Why the business world is worried about proposed tax on remittances and 'revenge tax'
item.description: For decades, the U.S. has welcomed the flow of foreign capital into the country. But two tax measures nestled into President Trump's spending package could change that.

item.title: New exhibit portrays Black Alabama families after emancipation
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to museum director Ebony Howard about a new exhibit in Harpersville, Ala., that explores the lives of several Black families after emancipation.

item.title: If you want to make it in girls softball in Brooklyn, you better know how to chant
item.description: At these softball playoffs for 11- and 12-year-old girls, you may hear singing.Â There's a chant for almost every moment in the game and all of them require full-on K-Pop, selfie energy.

item.title: MAGA is split on whether the U.S. should join Israel in the conflict with Iran
item.description: In his inauguration speech, Trump said his proudest legacy would be that of peacemaker. Now some of his supporters say he risks betraying that promise if the U.S. joins Israel in its battle with Iran.

item.title: A trip through Morocco, via mountain bike
item.description: Jen Rose Smith recently documented an off-road bicycle tour of Morocco, and says it can be a way to enjoy a more "light-footed" travel experience.

item.title: This federal program helps track America's ecosystems. Trump's budget would gut it
item.description: Buried in the Trump administration's proposed 2026 budget is the near elimination of something called the Ecosystems Mission Area. It's a program that monitors living things and the health of the land and water they inhabit. NPR's Ari Daniel reports that career scientists are deeply concerned about the potential cut.
